content.raw:
I’d really recommend considering the URI scheme that I proposed [in the comments](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/35740/Gazebo+X?focusedCommentId=477822977#comment-477822977). I’m pretty sure it would make it **very** simple to parse the frame input strings, and also be more short and concise for users who are writing SDF files.

If we’re open to considering that scheme I’d be happy to whip up an implementation and open a PR.
content.html:
I’d really recommend considering the URI scheme that I proposed in the comments. I’m pretty sure it would make it very simple to parse the frame input strings, and also be more short and concise for users who are writing SDF files.

If we’re open to considering that scheme I’d be happy to whip up an implementation and open a PR.

content.raw:
yeah, xpath syntax is interesting because it's an existing standard

a child collision named `box`:

* in @mxgrey 's URI concept: `collision://box`
* with xpath syntax: `collision[@name="box"]`
content.html:
yeah, xpath syntax is interesting because it's an existing standard

a child collision named box:

  • in @mxgrey 's URI concept: collision://box
  • with xpath syntax: collision[@name="box"]

content.raw:
My personal feeling is that xpath would be like using a rocket launcher when all we need is a fly swatter.

That being said, there’s a lot of value in using an existing standard, and it would play well with sdformat since we’re already using xml. It’s also completely generalized, so we wouldn’t have to change the implementation if we ever modify the specification of sdformat, whereas the implementation of my proposal would be tied deeply to the sdformat spec.

If there’s interest in using xpath, I wouldn’t object to it.
content.html:
My personal feeling is that xpath would be like using a rocket launcher when all we need is a fly swatter.

That being said, there’s a lot of value in using an existing standard, and it would play well with sdformat since we’re already using xml. It’s also completely generalized, so we wouldn’t have to change the implementation if we ever modify the specification of sdformat, whereas the implementation of my proposal would be tied deeply to the sdformat spec.

If there’s interest in using xpath, I wouldn’t object to it.

content.raw:
Yeah, agreed on the account of complexity, esp. given that XPath can do things like select multiple \(or no\) elements \(which yeah, ain’t useful here\). But I do think it should still be considered as an alternative.

Ultimately, though, my preference for this initial rev is that we don’t do anything special for scoping elements \(see below about simplifying the approach to avoid too much backwards incompatibility\), but defer that to a more detailed design discussion \(Steven’s Gist or the older markdown doc\).

@scpeters Is it OK if we post that markdown doc here?

Or rather, what should be the, uh, “contemporary” forum for discussing composition bits?
content.html:
Yeah, agreed on the account of complexity, esp. given that XPath can do things like select multiple (or no) elements (which yeah, ain’t useful here). But I do think it should still be considered as an alternative.

Ultimately, though, my preference for this initial rev is that we don’t do anything special for scoping elements (see below about simplifying the approach to avoid too much backwards incompatibility), but defer that to a more detailed design discussion (Steven’s Gist or the older markdown doc).

@scpeters Is it OK if we post that markdown doc here?

Or rather, what should be the, uh, “contemporary” forum for discussing composition bits?

content.raw:
Both ign-gazebo and ign-physics use sdf8. This PR goes to sdformat default which is version7. So, I don't think this will break anyone until we merge it into the gz11 branch on sdformat. 

We can also make another sdf8 prerelease before merging  sdfomat default into the gz11 branch so that ign-gazebo and ign-physics can run CI against debs while we update their code bases.

I could also be overlooking something here.
content.html:
Both ign-gazebo and ign-physics use sdf8. This PR goes to sdformat default which is version7. So, I don't think this will break anyone until we merge it into the gz11 branch on sdformat.

We can also make another sdf8 prerelease before merging sdfomat default into the gz11 branch so that ign-gazebo and ign-physics can run CI against debs while we update their code bases.

I could also be overlooking something here.

content.raw:
A note from pull request #505: "Also, the SetPose methods update the `Vertex` pose data but don't update the `Matrix4d`s in the edges. This is marked as a TODO."

I just experimented with fixing this TODO in [branch pose_dom_update_edges](#!/osrf/sdformat/branch/pose_dom_update_edges?dest=pose_dom#diff), but it fails to compile due to some `const` API's in `sdf::Model` and `ignition::math::graph::Graph` (see commit messages and [ign-math issue 99](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/issues/99/graphhh-doesnt-expose-non-const-reference)).

I'm going to ignore this for now, as dynamic updates to the frame graph are a lower priority.
content.html:
A note from pull request #505: "Also, the SetPose methods update the Vertex pose data but don't update the Matrix4ds in the edges. This is marked as a TODO."

I just experimented with fixing this TODO in branch pose_dom_update_edges, but it fails to compile due to some const API's in sdf::Model and ignition::math::graph::Graph (see commit messages and ign-math issue 99).

I'm going to ignore this for now, as dynamic updates to the frame graph are a lower priority.

content.raw:
xref from #200: To keep the scope of this feature simple \(esp. given the desire to have this land soon\), is it possible to only create implicitly named frames for links and joints?

Implicitly named frames for models, collisions, and visuals may complicate things; models are related to composition \(namespacing, encapsulation, etc.\), and collision \+ visuals are related to backwards compat. \(And I’m not sure how useful implicit frames for collisions / visuals really are, anywho…\)
content.html:
xref from #200: To keep the scope of this feature simple (esp. given the desire to have this land soon), is it possible to only create implicitly named frames for links and joints?

Implicitly named frames for models, collisions, and visuals may complicate things; models are related to composition (namespacing, encapsulation, etc.), and collision + visuals are related to backwards compat. (And I’m not sure how useful implicit frames for collisions / visuals really are, anywho…)

content.raw: I'm working on documenting this more completely elsewhere, but I think there is an exception to the stated case for when a frame attribute is empty: if the pose frame is unspecified for a joint element, I think it should default to the child link frame, to match the behavior of sdf 1.4.
content.html: I'm working on documenting this more completely elsewhere, but I think there is an exception to the stated case for when a frame attribute is empty: if the pose frame is unspecified for a joint element, I think it should default to the child link frame, to match the behavior of sdf 1.4.
